message.content:
<<<api>>>: ArrayList.remove
<<<code>>>: public void drop(String name){
    Iterator<Item> iterator = myArray.iterator();
    while(iterator.hasNext()){
        Item item = iterator.next();
        if(item.getName().contains(name) && !currentRoom.hasItem()){
            currentRoom.addItem(item);
            iterator.remove();
            currentMessage = "You have successfully dropped the item in the room";
            return;
        }
        else if(item.getName().contains(name) && currentRoom.hasItem()){
            currentMessage = "The room already has an item";
            return;
        }
    }
    currentMessage = "You do not have that item";
}
<<<explanation>>>: In your code, you are using a for-each loop to iterate over the ArrayList. However, when you remove an item from the ArrayList inside the loop, it can cause a ConcurrentModificationException. To avoid this, you can use an Iterator to iterate over the ArrayList and remove the item using the Iterator's remove() method. Additionally, you should use the return statement after setting the currentMessage to avoid unnecessary iterations after finding a match.
